intro: Cassinia subtropica, commonly known as the subtropical cassinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in subtropical climates. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in spherical shapes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cassinia subtropica is often used in landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
